title: Dozens of volunteers canvas Boston for homeless people outside as blizzard bears down on the city
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Pine Street Inn's outreach teams canvassed Boston during a nor'easter, providing supplies and rides to shelter for homeless people.
The blizzard dumped over 16 inches of snow on Boston, with nearly 50 people found outside in harsh weather conditions.
Pine Street Inn shelters, with a 585-bed capacity, accommodated over 660 people using cots and mats during the storm.

title: 50 percent of departing Boston Logan Airport flights canceled Tuesday
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: 50% of Tuesday flights from Boston Logan Airport canceled due to a powerful nor'easter impacting New England.
Amtrak suspended service between Boston's South Station and New York due to severe weather, uncertain about Tuesday operations.
Nearly 270 flights canceled and 14 delayed from Boston Logan, with resumption dependent on weather conditions and aircraft availability.

title: To trade or not to trade? Bruins must make their call with Viktor Arvidsson.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins face a decision on trading Viktor Arvidsson ahead of the March 6 NHL trade deadline.
Arvidsson, acquired for a 2027 fifth-round pick, has contributed 14 goals and 28 points in 45 games this season.
The Bruins hold the final Wild Card spot with a 61% playoff chance, complicating trade decisions involving Arvidsson.

title: These Mass. schools are closed on Tuesday, Feb. 24.
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Massachusetts schools close due to over 30 inches of snow from a winter storm.
Numerous school districts like Boston, Cambridge, and Worcester remain closed on February 24.
Some districts, such as Athol-Royalston and Littleton, experience delayed openings.

title: AJ Brown recalls ‘critical’ Mike Vrabel moments that changed hatred to respect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: AJ Brown discussed on a podcast how his relationship with coach Mike Vrabel evolved from dislike to respect.
Vrabel's coaching style, emphasizing player accountability and engagement, influenced Brown's successful rookie season with the Titans.
As of 2026, Brown is frequently mentioned as a potential trade candidate to the Patriots, who need receiver improvements.

title: US women’s hockey declines invite to State of the Union, men’s hockey also invited in viral Trump phone call
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: U.S. women's hockey team declined President Trump's invitation to the State of the Union due to scheduling conflicts.
The U.S. men's hockey team, also gold medalists, was invited to events at the State of the Union and White House.
NHL resumes Wednesday, potentially conflicting with U.S. men’s hockey players attending events in Washington.

title: Patriots cut running back Antonio Gibson to save cap space
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots released running back Antonio Gibson, saving over $3 million in cap space.
Gibson, 27, was recovering from a torn ACL but was a key player in the past two seasons.
His release leaves the Patriots searching for backup behind running backs Rhamondre Stevenson and TreVeyon Henderson.

title: Yes, this storm is officially a blizzard. Here’s what meteorologists want you to know.
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Meteorologists declared a blizzard for parts of Massachusetts and Rhode Island, including Boston and Providence, as of Monday morning.
Blizzard conditions require low visibility of 1/4 mile or less for three hours, with winds of 35 mph or greater.
The National Weather Service warns of whiteout conditions, potential power outages, and dangerous travel during the blizzard warning.

title: Video captures blizzard conditions in downtown Boston
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: A nor'easter brought near-whiteout conditions and stinging winds to downtown Boston on Monday, captured by photographer Jack Coen.
Snow reached around 14 inches in Pawtucket, R.I., and forecasts predict up to 24 inches in some Massachusetts areas.
The National Weather Service reported damaging wind gusts, causing significant snow drifts and hazardous conditions in Boston.

title: Tom Brady’s WWE comments have landed him at the top of Randy Orton’s RKO list
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Randy Orton wants to hit Tom Brady with an RKO after Brady called WWE 'cute' on Logan Paul's podcast.
Brady and Logan Paul are set to compete in the Fanatics Flag Football Classic with current and former NFL stars.
Orton will attempt his 10th elimination chamber match Saturday, aiming to face WWE champion Drew McIntyre at Wrestlemania 42.
